title: The Papers: Rotten Met and 'trial of Boris Johnson' begins
description: Tuesday's papers lead with the Met Police being deemed "institutionally racist, misogynistic and homophobic".

title: Ukraine says Russian missiles destroyed in Crimea
description: If confirmed as a Ukrainian attack, it would be a rare foray into the occupied region.

title: Euro 2024: Italy manager Mancini bemoans lack of Italian talent in Serie A
description: Italy manager Roberto Mancini says he is "worse off" than England boss Gareth Southgate when it comes to selecting national players.

title: Aleksandar Mitrovic: Fulham striker charged with violent and improper conduct after red card
description: Fulham’s Aleksandar Mitrovic is charged with violent and improper conduct after his red at Manchester United, but the Football Association says the standard punishment is “clearly insufficient”.

title: The 'dear' friendship of Xi and Putin... in 62 seconds
description: As Putin welcomes Xi to Moscow, the BBC examines the relationship between the two world leaders.

title: Danish far-right leader banned from UK over threat to burn Quran in Wakefield
description: Rasmus Paludan had said he planned to burn the Islamic text in Wakefield.

title: PSV Eindhoven: Fan given 40-year stadium ban for attack on Sevilla goalkeeper Marko Dmitrovic
description: A pitch invader who attacked Sevilla goalkeeper Marko Dmitrovic during a Europa League tie has been banned from PSV Eindhoven's stadium for 40 years.

title: Spotify: Bollywood songs removed from music app

title: Saudi Arabia invited Iran's President Raisi to visit, Tehran says
